result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jerome Newell Jr

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Services Status Report ( missed office contact).

Defendant Michael Jerome Newell Jr in court.  
Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Michael Jerome Newell Jr.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Review Hearing.
Parties waiting for Court of Appeals Decision.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Court reduced cash bail. 
Justice Point Supervision to Level 5  and other conditions of bail previously ordered remain in place.

Defendant Michael Jerome Newell Jr in court, in custody.  
Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Michael Jerome Newell Jr.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. State advises the court there are no victims in this case.
Bailbond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. 
Court GRANTED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Case remains calendared in Branch 19 for Review Hearing on October 21, 2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Michael Jerome Newell Jr in court, in custody.  
Attorney Jeff Schwarz for Ashley Fard in court for Michael Jerome Newell Jr.  
Attorney Wiliam Ackell for  Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Bail Bond Hearing,. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Defense request an adjournment due to the Counsel of record is unavailable for today's proceedings.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Michael J. Newell, Jr. - #2022006200, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Michael Jerome Newell not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a review hearing. Defendant not present and not produced for today's hearing. Defense is in the process of filing an appeal. Defense requested a bail review. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Michael Jerome Newell not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Caroline Pellegrino appears for the State of Wisconsin under student practice rules and under the supervision of ADA William R. F. Ackell. Courts findings placed on record. Court will sign stay of proceedings and finds good cause to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Interlocutory Motion to Stay Trial Proceedings and Proposed Order, Filed.

Defendant Michael Jerome Newell in court with Attorney Ashley Fard; both appear by video.  Defendant Michael Jerome Newell in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Fard has filed a motion to be addressed by the trial court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Christopher B.; Bonny H.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Michael Jerome Newell in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Michael Jerome Newell in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Jerome Newell appeared by video means with Attorney.  As advised by ADA in court per case notes, Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
